answerText: phenolphthalein[10] Phenolphthalein is a member of this class of compounds that change color when the pH of a solution changes.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 2 | 18 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This substance is a component of the Kastle-Meyer solution, which is used to test for the presence of blood.  [10] Name this compound that is colorless in acidic solutions and pink in basic ones.
